diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis with choledocholithiasis and acute cholangitis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with localized left upper quadrant (LUQ) and right upper quadrant (RUQ) abdominal pain, along with notable tenderness in those areas. Imaging findings showed a distended gallbladder with moderate wall edema, pericholecystic fluid, and multiple gallstones, highly suggestive of acute cholecystitis. Additionally, a filling defect in the distal common bile duct compatible with a stone indicated choledocholithiasis, and mild dilation of intrahepatic bile ducts suggested cholangitis.
